newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sanyo Securities shares extend losses.
newsitem.headline: Sanyo Securities shares extend losses.

text.p: Shares in Sanyo Securities Co Ltd extended early losses and dipped to an all-time low in Friday afternoon trade, following news that the brokerage house asked several life insurers to delay repayment of its subordinated loans, traders said.
At 0419 GMT, the shares traded 44 yen lower at 150 yen, a record low, making the firm the sharpest percentage loser on the first section of the Tokyo bourse.
Its trading volume was 2.181 million shares.
A Sanyo Securities spokesman told Reuters earlier on Friday that the company had asked life insurers for a postponement of repayment of some subordinated debts due at the end of July.

The spokesman said that the medium-sized brokerage has a total of 20 billion yen in subordinated loans from life insurers, including Nippon Life Insurance Co. He did not disclose, however, how much of that amount was due for repayment later this month.
